abstracts.cdata!:
The Water Supply and Sewerage Project
            consists of the following: (i) construction and equipment of
            three wells and a pumping station including the development
            of three springs; (ii) construction of a reservoir,
            transmission and distribution pipelines including house
            connections and water meters; (iii) construction of three
            intakes and pipelines; (iv) improvements and repairs to
            existing water supply facilities, new maintenance facilities
            including vehicles, buildings and equipment for data
            collection and billings; (v) drilling and testing six
            exploratory wells; (vi) construction of about 40 km of
            sewers including waste stabilization ponds at Dobighat and
            Kodku; (vii) institutional and on-the-job training of WSSB
            staff; and (viii) engineering and management services to
            complete the project, and conduct a tariff study and
            feasibility studies and detailed engineering for future construction.
